overview:
As CTO of Brevity, Abdul has evolved his vision into the Brevity Solution by leading his team through product and technical development.

Abdul had an early inherent ability to understand how intricate technology systems work. In 2007, Abdul teamed up with Jacob Bronstein to develop Arctic Media Technologies. Together they developed and built the Olympus and Athena systems for ESPN. This broadcast video server system has made ESPN’s workflow significantly more efficient while solving major problems with digital content retrieval. The Athena system was one of ESPN’s largest storage arrays for several years. Abdul co-founded Brevity with Jacob Bronstein in 2010.

Abdul has an innate understanding of large and complicated production and post-production workflows, an ability that has helped refine the Brevity Solution so that it maintains simplicity.

Abdul is a graduate of the University of Connecticut.
